text:
I tried my first savory crepe. I was skeptical and ordered the pizza crepe. It was strange. The pizza favors were there but tastes strange with the actual crepe.

The crepe itself was delicious without he pizza filling.

I would suggest tryin a different savory crepe
The best breakfast crepe we have ever ate! The service is great and friendly.. The crepe is delicious and big! If you don't eat a lot just share. We will totally come back thank you!!

I was craving a crepe. So I came here. First off. The guy making the crepe looked angry the whole time, throwing everything around. Second, the guys was making a mess and couldn't make the crepes the right way. He also forgot to put Nutella/chocolate on my crepes. This has to the number one worse place to eat a crepe. Then guy wants to argue about what I said, when I never said any of that. Terrible service and terrible place to eat a crepe. Don't eat here. Everyone face that ordered at this place was very disappointed and not happy with their crepe.

reichhaltiges, frisch zubreitetes Frühstück im Crêpe eingewickelt... 8$ ..reicht aber auch für 2 Personen wenn man über den Tag nicht zu aktiv ist...Kaffee kostet 3.5$
Essen schmeckt ganz passabel, da es nicht so fett-und zukerhaltig ist wie manch' anderes Frühstück hier...

Ridiculously great food....Ridiculously great crew!

Crazy delicious and generous crepes.  We chose to skip a buffet and come here.   So glad we did.   Started or morning off great. 

We came back the very next day.   The staff remembered us and even helped us find great attractions to visit.

If you like lots of egg in your crepe, get the Sausage and Egg Crepe. The ratio of eggs to sausage was high and it was soft.

I also like the NY Pizza Crepe because they put plenty of pepperoni and it wasn't greasy. Meat lovers will rejoice. Wish the pepperoni was a bit more grilled or crunchier, but it was alright.

You will have to wait a bit, especially during lunch or dinner, but you can bet they are working as fast as they can to get your order out. I watched these guys make lots of crepes and they don't stop to take a breath. We waited about 15-20 minutes with 5-6 orders before us.

The cashier black girl was really rude, I wish I can give no star at all. Crepes we're just ok, nothing to write home about. The cashier girl was spitting in the sink washing her mouth and nose?! Aren't you suppose to do it home before coming to work or use a restroom for God's sake...

A 45 minute wait doesn't make up for a decent crepe when the customer service has rude, insulting cooks. Next time I'll go to Paris hotel's creperie where the customer service is polite and the wait time is 20 minutes.

Food: The crepes are great and there are healthy breakfast and vegerarian options.
Rating: Four stars

Service: The register service was good, but the restaurant needs to add another person to prepare orders during peak times.
Rating: Two stars

Atmosphere: If you can find a table, the atmoshere is great.  If not, eating the crepes can be challenging.
Rating: Three stars

Location: New York New York is great.
Rating: Five stars

I was really excited to try this place, but unfortunately the customer service was bad and the crepe was ok.
It took 25 minutes to get my crepe - there were 3 ladies there and instead of making it they all stood there talking for about 15-20 minutes about how much they hated working there, once they were done they began making it, it took 5 minutes only to make it wrong on the first try.  

The crepe itself was ok, but it left a weird after-taste.

Best waffle ever crispy and not soft hard the line was long but it seemed to go by quickly the cooks in the morning get the crepes out fast cool watching them work food was good I got a bacon and egg crepe too they asked me if I wanted sour cream or white grave I said white gravy it was fantastic can't wait to eat more
I tried stake& mushroom crape and tomato caprese crape. Service was fast and crapes were delicious!
I love that this place is open before 9am. There crepes are so fresh! They make it right in front of u. You eat it straight off the griddle no window time. Love it!

Customer service is so so but what do you expect when your establishment is in the New York New York casino and you cater to a-holes all day. Food is a great value. Large selection of sweet and breakfast style crepes for under $10. Good value

Great choice for breakfast in a land of many choices. Price was great. Food was great. It took about 15 min to get our crepes because there were so many people ahead of us, but the staff worked quickly without compromising quality.
Quick, reasonably priced, and TASTY!! I had the steak and mushroom and my gf had the ham and cheese; better than any Philly cheesesteak I've ever had!
Maybe the best breakfast value in the area. My wife had a sweet crepe and myself a savory one. Well made, well seasoned, we both were happy. Friendly people as well.

The crepes here are amazing! We had three groups ask us where we got the crepes before we had a chance to eat them. They are thick and full of yummy goodness. Other crepe shops in vegas have thin crepes with very little filling so if you are looking for something more juicy and filling then this is the place to go!
I have a serious crepe problem.  Had this for dessert one night after the steakhouse and it was great... only problem was they were out of ice cream!
Oh my gosh!  Sooooooo good!  And for the price i think its the best deal on vegas.  Had the steak and mushroom.  Paid $22 for two of them (boyfriend had ine too).  Delicious.
Quick walk from MGM Grand, not a bad price for breakfast. Definitely a large meal. Service was fast and friendly. Coffee leaves a little to be desired but there is a Starbucks right down the way.

This place is ABSOLUTELY worth the money! Stopped here after a walk on the strip and dinner! Was a perfect dessert to share with my husband! Also perfect for my first "real" crepe! My photo is of the Strawberry Marscopone Crepe from On the Sweet Side.

I schlepped all the way over here from my hotel as the reviews seemed good and I was in the mood for a crepe. I wasn't expecting much, and I got much less. I got a savory crepe, and it was bland to the point of being gross. Like, I couldn't even finish it...no amount of hot sauce made it palatable. I didn't get sick from it or anything, it was just...meh, and extremely over priced for it.
Good food takes time. Food was delicious. In vegas it's hard to find somewhere not filled with smoke. Inside New York New York it was nice to find such a delicious place.

This was our second time trying out this place and we are in love! Today we ordered the sausage and egg crepe along with the steak and mushroom. They both were amazing and the sauce on each were delicious! Last time we got the sweet crepes and they were good but overly sweet for us. We used a bogo coupon through myvegas and ended up paying $8 for 2 crepes. It's an awesome deal and the crepe are pretty big. We will be returning to this spot next time we visit! I highly recommend trying it out.

The aroma walking by here makes you want to stop and get a crepe. They have breakfast crepes (with eggs) and the have crepes with fruits. They are quick and make everything infront of you. The crepe although alright, did not satisfy my taste buds.

Crepe shop in New York New York. They serve sweet and savory crepes to order.  The breakfast Crepe was  a bit too bland. The cannoli Crepe was sweet heaven. Good for a quick stop for a bite while gambling.

12/26/2015

Healthy breakfast crepe and the chocolate banana crepe. 

Both good and delicious. Don't wait to eat it on the go. It'll get soggy. Eat it in NYNY on any one of the dining tables around the food courts.
I ordered the strawberry crept and the healthy breakfast. The food was a bit when I would recommend seasoning it to your taste.  But it is a nice quick but first place before he started.

I got a chocolate banana with extra strawberry crepe and my husband got New York pizza crepe and both was amazing! We love it. The portion are huge and we got so full. I highly recommend. Little bit pricy but worth it.

The food is good, the attitude of the cashier is very shitty, I thought I was begging for her food, not buying.  
the others were nice.

Nothing beat a Nutella banana crepe early morning, This place was a little hard to find , even with a gps, but once you find it(Inside New York- New York) is great. I had the bacon and egg breakfast and it was really good, my son got the Nutella banana crepe.
Nice little place if you are looking for a good quick breakfast. For drinks they have smoothies and coffee( I prefer Starbucks, is just right next to 48th and crepe)

I came here with a buy one get one free offer from "My Vegas slots game" reward.

I got a 2 strawberry and a banana dessert crepe and it came out to $9.71.   If there was no reward, this would have been $20.71. This would be expensive without the reward, but I would still come because I had friendly customer service and the crepe was so big,warm and delicious. 

The fruits were fresh and they were very generous with their toppings (hazelnut and powdered sugar). 

I would definitely come back.
Really good especially the ham and egg crepes. Don't recommend the bacon and egg because the bacon tasted burnt. The waffles are delicious even more so with the fresh strawberries.

This location is inside the New York New York hotel. It is one of those places where you order and then take your food to a table kind of like fast food or food court style. The service was extremely slow but I did take in consideration that they had a line pretty much around the restaurant for people waiting for crepes. The creek are delicious and the portions are huge. Two people can probably split one crepe. Given the fact it is inside a hotel, the prices are decent. I would return probably during a less busy time.

I am sure (hoping) that there is something in the menu that is good. I ordered a ham and cheese crepe and felt like my 9 year old daughter made it. 2 slices of white American cheese followed by lunch meat. This was the worst crepe I have ever eaten. The only reason the stars are not a one is because the actually crepe itself tasted good and was cooked correctly.

If you want a crepe go to the Paris hotel.

Really amazing crepes!! My husband and I split two crepes. One would have been plenty to split as the portions are huge. The breakfast crepe with bacon and eggs was delicious. For an extra treat, we shared the peach crepe which was also delicious. The crepe maker was friendly and took great pride in his work!

Food that was barely fair quality, and really lousy service. 

My family and I needed to get our breakfast before getting picked up for the return trip to the airport. We got our orders in and then watched as it took 20 minutes to complete four single-portion orders ahead of us before even STARTING on our order. We ended up having to get our orders set up to-go and eat them at the airport.  There's a crepe shop we go to in Albany, CA that can finish orders for our usual three-person party in less than ten minutes even with other orders ahead of us. 

The universal judgment  when we did eat them was "edible, but I've had better." (see shop in Albany, CA above)  None of us even bothered to finish our crepes.

I haven't had a crepe in over a decade and my wife hasn't had one ever. We ordered breakfast here, and god was it good. They were slammed busy, and both the chef and crepe maker both still took their time and made it to perfection. Took about twenty minutes before we were able to enjoy the yummy goodness. I highly recommend stopping here to visit if you want a nice eclectic French fusion.
Pleasant and hard working staff. Service was fast. The breakfast ham and egg crape I ordered was delicious and very filling. Definitely planning on returning during my next stay.

Awesome little place for breakfast ..

The Good: food was awesome the lady at counter taking order was sweet. Few mins wait and crepe came out awesome ...

The Bad: none

The Ugly: none

Waited in line for over 20 minutes, then was given a "Tomato Caprese" crepe that was just tomatoes and cheese. I asked about the basil, the main ingredient to anything marketed as "caprese," and was told that they were out. I was not told this at the cashier, but was so tired of waiting that I just took it and left. So unprofessional to not inform customers of ingredient shortages until after an item is made.

Crepes always look good but when we ordered and got to the cashier she told us my boyfriend's card did not go through. I tried my card and was told it was also not accepted. 

We were extremely disappointed since we had been looking forward to trying that place for a while now. The staff was very rude and snotty which was also unappreciated. 

We then went on to buy crepes at Paris and they were delicious. And our card definitely worked there. 

Fix your register and the attitude of the staff.
The healthy breakfast is pretty good. This was the first time I have had a crepe and the portion was quite large. The service was great and fast !!!
Our sausage and egg crepe was yummy, and good size for the price. Our cashier Maria was very friendly!

I ordered the bacon and egg crepe. It is good. I normally don't order crepes with hot food in them but I wanted to give it a try. I prefer my crepes like a desert.  Example: Strawberry and Nutella with powder sugar.

First time in Vegas and we were looking for a nice breakfast place for a quick bite. Everything was great; good service, very affordable for Vegas, and big portions. I highly recommend the ham and cheese crepe as well as the irish coffee, super rich and filling.

This place has good crepes. I got the healthy breakfast version which was a little get. Could definitely help with a little sauce. Also was not properly stuffed as everything spilled out on my first bite.

The sweet crepes are also good, though a little on the sweeter side. My friends who got that had to throw away the last half as it became inedible because of the over sweetness. 

Would suggest sharing the sweet and savory ones so can taste both and don't get overloaded with one favor.

Worst crepe I have ever had. The dough was not cooked and it was too thick. It was over priced. They give you one large crepe. They would be better off giving you two smaller ones so they could cook them properly.

Amazing crepes. Place usually get very busy in the morning during breakfast hours. They have great variety of sweet and savory crepes. My personal favorite was banana crepe - absolute bliss. Must try if you like crepes
I have to say that i only had a waffle and it wasnt really that great. The flavors were good but the waffle was soft which when the butter, maple syurp were added just became soggy. So not so good

The crepes here are delicious! The prices are reasonable compared to other locations! Ordered the powered sugar crepe and added strawberries and chocolate chips! The worker went a little heavy on the chocolate chips, so I wasn't able to fully enjoy my crepe, but that just shows how generous they are with added toppings especially since there's an additional cost! The lines fill up here which makes service a bit slow, but the food is hot and fresh!

I def wanted a light and small brunch to start the day so I headed to get a crepe. Little did I know that the crepe was gonna be huge and the wait eternal! Were my crepes worth the wait??? Maybe. I mean they were good and filling but it took a very long time to get two crepes. There was a good handful of people constantly asking to follow up on their own crepes. One cashier, one person getting ingredients and one person ONLY making crepes. Poor guy looked miserable. He def wasn't happy and he looked super over worked. Here was four fire stations for the pans but just one person in a cramped place. Sigh. Most likely wouldn't come back, no patience for it when I'm hungry and ready to do more in Vegas. My order consisted of: Peach cobbler and tomato caprese. Peach cobbler had no real sense of it being "cobbler" taste other than a little sprinkle of some sort of granola. It was flavorful though with plenty of peaches and plenty of cream. As for th tomato caprese.... It had no pesto. I was too hungry and didn't feel like going to confront the over worked cook for pesto. It lacked flavor and was just ok.

#90/2015
This place has awesome crepes. I recommend the "Savory" crepes. The sweet ones are REALLY sugary.
Had the steak and mushroom crepe and the strawberry crepe I think. The steak and mushroom was okay but they just don't make a good combination. But I had the BOGO deal so I used it.

Slightly pricey, but not for Vegas. Good, and loaded with toppings. I ordered the buffalo chicken and it was piled with chicken, celery and a tasty sauce. It was the most "stuffed" crepe I've ever had. I was planning on going back and ordering a sweet crepe for my family to split, but now we're too full.

Another crepe spot, you know I had to try it. 

Quick review:
Smores crepe was super sweet. If you love the overloaded chocolate flavor then this is for you. Unfortunately, that isn't us so we ate half and had to toss the rest. 

Strawberry crepe has mascarpone cheese and I felt tgier was more of that than strawberries so a little too heavy for me. 

Plain nutella crepe was good. But how can you really mess that up. 

Service was good our cashier was friendly and the crepe maker was quick and fun to watch.

They are more on the expensive side compared to some other crepe places but they are in a hotel on the strip so I guess that makes sense.

I had the savory steak and mushrooms crepe and it was pretty good for its price. Crepes were made fresh. I learnt that if you use the My Vegas app, you can redeem a 2 for 1 crepe reward for this place. That's definitely a good deal if you are staying in vegas with another person and don't want to spend too much money for a good breakfast.
Dont order Buffalo chicken. Their chicken couldn't be any worse. Try something sweet like 99% of the people.
Super slow and non-caring attitude... the food is good tho but not worth the poor service

Ate here for breakfast with hubby and adult daughter.  They both had sausage and egg crepes. I had the healthy breakfast crepe.  All were huge.  All were tasty.  As a low carb eater; I ate only about 1/4 of the crepe itself;  but there was plenty of filling to satisfy my tummy.  $8.99 per crepe is reasonable in Vegas. And the "free" cup of water was decent water.

If you are staying at New York New York, check this place out for breakfast. The crepes are somewhat pricey, but it's Vegas right? 

I ordered the strawberry crepe and I asked them to cut it in half. They divided it in two and essentially gave me two crepes (on separate plates) because they didn't fold it over. 

This made it really easy to split and it also felt much more affordable. 

Great customer service.

This place was decent. Their touch of lemon one with raspberry was yummy, not to sour from the lemon. But the crepe was under cooked and made it kind of mushy. Also the 2 girls working there last night were not in good moods & it definitely showed and made you uncomfortable.

Only hate for 48th.

Slow service, mediocre crepes (we tried the caprese and one of the breakfast crepes), watery coffee. $7.99 for a damn waffle. 

Where to find it: Downstairs in the New York-York behind the casino. It's just a stand so you'll have to find seats at one of the tables along the walkway. I think the tables belong to the other restaurant but it doesn't matter.

Pro-tip: The deli across from it has breakfast specials from 9-11 and it's much better!

I'm so annoyed that I deleted my photos off my phone! When I stayed here this past mid August 2016 I stayed here at NYNY and came to this restaurant it was worth it! It was a little expensive but it was so good! The vanilla mascarpone cheese is amazing! I was actually kind of annoyed when I saw that it was going on my crepe but it ended up being delicious! Now when I got to other crepe shops they don't have the mascarpone!  But let me tell yo my that blueberry Crepe is amazing!! I think I maybe have poured some syrup on it idk, but it didn't even need it. Deff deprived of this place!

Ok, let's be fair and do the rating based on what it is and not in comparison to a five star restaurant. I will agree with others, the portions are quite large so be prepared to be hungry, I could only finish about half which is unfortunate because I hate wasting food! The service members were very polite and courteous. Everything was good for what it is at a little under $10 for a strawberry crepe. 

Again, it is what it is in a casino food court atmosphere with plenty of noise from those screaming on the roller coaster. It's close to Toms Irvan and Greenbergs deli in the food area section on the first floor.

I like that the crepes are freshly made and filings assembled right in front of you; breakfast and a show. :)  
Unfortunately, our crepes were slightly undercooked and the Swiss cheese had the taste of processed cheese. I tried to remove as much of the cheese as I could, but it was everywhere.  It was so disappointing! Neither my husband nor I could finish our breakfast.

Possibly the worst crepe I've ever had. 
I guess the creperies in the Bay Area have spoiled me. 
We had the caprese crepe and it was sweet and hardly savory. The mozzarella looked like it was one of the shredded ones you buy at the grocery...
To make matters worse, I fell ill after that. 
Definitely not going there ever again and will NOT recommend.

This place has huge amazing savory and sweet crepes. 

 This place is located across from the greenbergs deli in New York hotel. I have tried their pizza and strawberry crepes and both did not disappoint. I have had different crepes from the past, but the size of these crepes are bigger than average. The strawberry has a sweet flavor with cut strawberries and whipped cream on top. The pizza flavored one had mozzarella cheese and pepperoni toppings. Both were fantastic in a sweet and savory way.

 The service was very fast with and without a line. There are topping you could add, but I usually just go with what they have on standard. There is also a small beverage station to pick up drinks like soda and water. 

 The prices of these crepes are from cheap to moderate. The prices are about 5-10$ depending on what crepe you want. They have other flavors like lemon pie and BLT crepes, but I haven't tried them.

From 7/9/15
After checking out of our room we decided to get breakfast at 48th and Crepe. They have a variety of breakfast crepes, savory ones, and a list of sweet crepes.

I got a blueberry crepe with mascarpone cheese. It was so good, if I happen to be in the area early morning I will come back to try their other flavors-I'm a fan.

Today my wife and I tried the strawberry crepe it was delicious however the customer service was atrocious. Absolutely horrible. We were here 4-9-17 @ 743 pm. The cashier acted like we were bothering her with our order. We ordered right away did not take our time deciding yet she still acted like she had something better to do. There was no greeting no thank you at the end. When she walked up she said "what is it". Absolutely unacceptable. The crepe however was delicious. If u don't mind rudeness definitely order. 
The cook however was outstanding very polite and welcoming. He's The only reason we even gave any stars. 
The receipt says Corey took our order but we could not see her name badge. Her badge said she was from Santa Cruz. 
Unfortunately Won't be back. There are better ways to spend our money. Maybe we will just get donuts next time.
Stopped here for breakfast before heading to the strip.  Nice place for a quick bite. Great food made to order, reasonable prices, excellent and service!
Had this at NYNY. Not bad but nothing really special. I loved the "New York streets" there!

Good lunch idea.  The ham and cheese crepe was prefect size meal.  They had a sign for lunch only crepe and fountain pop for $9.99.  Basically the pop is free if you ask for lunch special.  The ham is Black Forest ham, they add two pieces of Swiss cheese, and add a cream sauce over the top.  

Everything is done in front of you.  The crepe is cooked on hot plates.  The ham is fried in skillet.  Everything is thrown together.  There was a steady line of people here.

Great value if you are looking for a good brunch on a budget. The wait can be long so send in your order ahead of time: everyone else does. One crepe could feed two unless you are very hungry. Be adventurous and order a savory and a sweet one and share with your Sweetie. The sports book is right around the corner so you can watch some games while you wait. Talk to the others that are waiting: you may find some other good deals! 

Much praise for the guy making the crepes. He had three griddles going and kept the extensive line moving. He was awesome!

So I'm stuck here in Las Vegas, flight delayed due to the snow storm in DC. This amazing gem is in the New York New York hotel.  So I was walking around the hotel early around 6 a.m. trying to find something to eat, much was not open. So to my surprise I noticed the 48th. I ordered the healthy crepe and it was excellent! I did not realize on the menu that you can also have fruit options which is also very good and delicious. I think I will have one for lunch since I'm here until 4 p.m. anyway

We didn't have crepes but we did get some Krispy Kreme doughnuts from here. The lady (Cory) was very friendly and helpful. It was later in the night and the doughnuts were not very fresh otherwise I would have given 4 stars.
Crepe tastes normal, very pricey. And it's not fulfilling at all, just a snack of some sort. Get something else instead if tou want something that will last you to lunch.
The food was ok for the value... But the customer service was sub par at best . Mairelis was not very friendly at all she looked very unwilling to help us.
Excellent crepes, customer service is rather nonexistent, but the breakfast was fabulous.

My boyfriend and I stopped here for breakfast one morning, finding the area from where we came in was a little confusing but the crepes were amazing. I had the banana chocolate crepe and he had the s'mores. Not insane prices, and huge portions for your money.

Right before I came to Vegas, I went to the amazing crepe place in Toronto (muncheez) and it made my stomach so happy that when I saw this creperie, I cried out for it ....or more so, my stomach cried out for the savoury crepes. 

The girl that was working looked so miserable and never smiled once except when joking around with the other coworkers... Honestly I don't blame her, because that's the same as me as well when I worked as a cashier way back in the day. She was super cold but she got the job done, so whatever. Or maybe that's the norm for Americans? 

The crepes were mediocre. The pizza one was super cheesy but the crepe itself was pretty soggy and sad. The buffalo chicken one is also meh, too much sour flavour in one soggy skin texture crepe... The one a worker made for herself before she went on break looked a lot better though ... 

It was nice to try but nope, see you never!

We went be a use we had a Bogo certificate to use up.  My husband had the ham & cheese and I tried the pizza version.  His was MUCH better and had a ton of filling.  They are a little pricey, almost $10 each and our 20oz Gatorade was $4.50 (yes for a 20 oz) plus tax so even with our coupon is was still almost $20.  I probably wouldn't go back but the ham and cheese was good.

Great location! My sis and I shared the veggie crepe and it was very tasty, there could have been more pesto though.  I think if they put some inside that would be great.  I had to ask for more. Good size crepe too. Another plus, was it wasn't outrageously expensive, which is hard to find in Vegas.  I wanted to try a desert crepe, but didn't have time.  Next time....

Amazing crepes. My husband and I were in Vegas and I saw this place on Yelp - and since we wanted to go to New York New York anyway, worked out great. We got the banana, Nutella, hazelnut crepe and it was fantastic! Great size, fresh and just how a crepe should be
This place had a nice bacon cheese burger and onion rings. Highly recommended if you get down to Vegas New York New York!

Quality crepes! I would highly suggest using the MyVegas up to earn real life Vegas rewards. We had crepes every morning on vacation buy 1 get 1 free using my rewards. This made for a very cheap breakfast option daily.

The crepes here were a bit odd.  I didn't like the texture or the taste of the batter. My friend and I split a breakfast crepe.  We got the sausage and egg crepe.  It was definitely a good size to fill you up.  The crepe wasn't horrible just a bit off than what I would normally taste from other crepe places.  The dough was just really off and threw the rest if the taste off.  I wouldn't come back unless they changed their crepe batter.
I had the smores crepe, It was really good, but its too much food, its WAY sweet

kinda yum!!! veggie crepe with spinach, tomato, sautéed mushrooms, caramelized onions with pesto sauce served on a PLASTIC plate because there is no GAS in the hotel!!! apparently the construction of the hockey arena hit the GAS line & no HOT food or water til later in the evening?!? #foodPORN #noFOODgasm #sheWASoHUNGRY #bestCREPEver #DIVAstyle #dallasDIVAS #teamVEGAN #teamORGANIC #veggieCREPE #blessedANDhighlyFAVORED #noHOTwater #gladIwasUPearly #noHOTfood #getANelectricOVEN #nynyHOTELasvegas #48thandCREPE
Great crepes at 48th. I always stop by for a ham and cheese when I am in town. The crepes are huge and can be shared unless you are really hungry. They also serve up breakfast crepes in the morning.
Good crepe.  Awesome service.  Nothing to write home about.  Super friendly staff.  Got the raspberry lemon. It was good.

Mmm... Breakfast. It's the most important meal of the day, and while I was in Vegas I was trying to not eat too horribly, so I was excited by the menu at 48th and Crepe. First of all, this restaurant is located in the New York, New York hotel in a cool NY neighborhood themed food court area. The theme in that area is just really relaxing and it's a nice place to grab a table and plan your day. My friends and I arrived for breakfast pretty early, and there wasn't much of a line. 

I ordered the breakfast crepe with egg whites, spinach, and tomatoes (no mushrooms for me). The cashier asked if I wanted cheese so I added swiss, which really added to the flavor. The crepes are huge, and I ended up sharing a bit of mine with one of my friends. It was too much for me to finish. My friend pointed out that the spinach had a hint of basil in it. I don't know if that was an accident or not, but the flavor was great.  

This is another spot I'd happily return to. It was fast, healthy, and budget-friendly.

My family loves crepes. In fact, I have a well worn crepe pan at home. Parisian crepes or Tokyo crepes, love them both. With that said, this place serves up average crepes. I agree with other Yelpers that they are a bit on the thick side. 
My family shared a Nutella and cream filled crepe. It was satisfying. I can't believe I'm saying this, but there was too much Nutella overwhelming the crepe. 
If you are craving a crepe, you will be satisfied. But, for the price (even for Vegas), you might feel like you wished you had gone elsewhere.

My BFF & I saw this place on our way to the box office and she had to get something!  We got the caprese crepe and banana & choclate crepe.  Both were delish and huge!  1 is more than enough to share between 2 but we wanted to try a savory & a sweet.  Both were good but the savory tomato, cheese & balsamic crepe was my favorite.  It was so tasty!  4 stars because customer service is lacking.  Does anyone smile in NY NY???

Mmm, crepes!

The line moves pretty quickly and the crepes are made fast. We ordered a lemon twist and strawberry crepe. The lemon was pretty sour (because of the lemon curd, which was tasty) and the strawberry was pretty sweet. Both crepes were good, but I thought it was just average tasting. 

It's a good stop if you just want a quick meal (savory crepe) or a sweet dessert (sweet crepe).

The Crepe was delicious, no doubt; but the customer service was lacking. 

Date of visit: 06-23-2018 (Saturday) 
Time of visit: 12:00 noon

I was excited to visit this place because I heard reviews about it before arriving to New York, New York Resort and Casino. The crepes were delicious; however the staff was very unprofessional and unenthused about being there. The staff had very rude responses and remarks criticizing customers in plain view of other customers.

I find this type of behavior not only inappropriate but very unbecoming of a novelty restaurant that caters to 90% tourists. This lack of customer service and professionalism is not a very good impression on tourists providing this is a very busy resort.

Incident referenced: a customer whom has already purchased some food, comes back to the counter to ask about condiments. The female representative at the time cooking, scoffs, and replies in a rude manner, "No, we don't have that", then she proceeds to chat to another employee (older gentlemen) in the front area about how "ridiculous" the customers request was and they continue to laugh and carry on criticizing the customer asking about condiments as if the customer should know better. 

In addition the front cooking area exposed to customers was extremely messy and not very appetizing. It was just plain dirty. (see picture attached) 

I'm appalled by this behavior and quite frankly individuals like these have no business in the hospitality industry; if you don't like customers that are providing your salary and keeping you gainfully employed maybe you should find a different job that doesn't deal with customer interaction. 

I will not return to this place nor anyone I know that are visiting NY, NY Resort in Las Vegas.
Really good crepes! For breakfast I highly recommend the sausage egg and cheese crepe. Don't waste your money on a nasty casino buffet, come get a crepe and be completely satisfied.

Giving them 3 , because i cant really judge from the taste of my order, with out having all the ingredients. I had the Vegetarian which is mushrooms, roma tomatoes, onions , and spinach with pesto.. and like every where else today.....(Starbucks) ... they are out of something and of course it's mushrooms. i tried adding banana peppers to attempt at adding some meat to my potato... if you know what i mean. Long story short, pesto sauce was just drizzled on top would've help if it was actually mixed in with veggies. lacked flavor seasoning, something! Hot sauce helped a little not much.. buy the time i finished writing this I'm changing it to 2stars..

SLOW!!!! Son, daughter, and wife ordered here. Three crepes and line was not long at all. I went elsewhere, got a hot dog, ate my hot dog, got up, walked around, got pizza, shared pizza with family, 25 minutes later, opened Yelp, typed this message, and still no crepes.

On a recent (and my first) trip the Las Vegas, 48th and Crepe somehow became my go-to spot.  We were staying at New York-New York, so in the morning (or around noon, to be honest) when it was finally time to eat something, this was a quick enough option.  They have breakfast crepes, so it gave me the breakfast I wanted without much hassle. I had the egg and bacon crepe for my first two trips.  I also had a sweet crepe with Nutella on my third (and final) trip here.

You order at the counter, then wait for them to call your name.  It is a little bit pricey for a crepe, but I think most restaurants in hotels are overpriced. The staff was nice and friendly.  On the first day (Saturday morning), there were quite a few people waiting for crepes, but it still only took about 15 minutes, which was fair to me.  The crepe wasn't totally the best thing ever, but it was good!!!  It was large and full of food, so it was more than enough and kept me full for quite some time.

48th and Crepe doesn't have it's own seating area, but there are tables scattered throughout the area it is in.

I also appreciated their service on my last visit there, because they had accidentally added strawberries to my banana and Nutella crepe.  (My friend had ordered her's with strawberries, which was an upcharge.)  Opposed to throwing it out and starting over, charging me, or just not acknowledging it, they informed me they had put strawberries on it and asked if I still wanted that or another. (I love strawberries, so of course I happily took it.)  I appreciated that and the fact that the crepes hit the spot every day I spent in Vegas!
Absolutely worth the wait!! I ordered a strawberry and blueberry crepe and amazed at how fresh the strawberries were! Service was great and they were friendly even when it was busy!

Food was ok. Nothing great about it. We ordered three different crepes to try and it's nothing wowed us. asked for some Nutella drizzle on my strawberry crepe cause it had no flavor and she gave me an attitude.

Their crepes are HUGE! You could absolutely share a crepe between 2 people, especially one of the savory crepes. The dessert options are pretty big too.  I remember the Steak and Mushroom one being amazing, but now that I'm vegetarian, I go for the Vegetarian crepe, with spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes. The breakfast one with all that plus eggs is a winner too. In my experience, they're happy to do substitutions at no charge, which is nice, since I prefer the Bechamel sauce over the garlic or pesto, just personal preference.  At $10 each, this place is a big bargain for the amount of food you get. This is one of the quick service places I make sure to go to every time I'm in Vegas. Highly recommend!

Great place for a quick breakfast that isn't total fast food. They even threw on a little ham free of charge after I learned it cost 4$ to add ham and changed my mind. Great service. The list of fresh ingredients is worth paying a little extra though you could buy half a lb of meat at the store for 4$. But hey, it's Vegas.

The crepes that they make here are actually pretty decent. I usually go with the classic Nutella and strawberry flavor crepe, and they also sprinkle some sugar powder on there too! You can always add an ice cream flavor to your crepe too, which is super tasty yet sweet. 

The price can be a little pricey, but the quality of the crepes is better than an average crepe!
I would have given the place 5 stars if I didn't have to wait forever.  If you have 30-40 minutes then the crepes are fantastic.
Love this place! I ordered a blueberry crepe and it's very yummy. The most important thing for me is the crepe is not too sweet! I will come again!

Super good crapes! I had the steak and mushroom crapes and it came out amazing. I don't know the lady's name who made it but she definitely knows her craft. Five out of five stars I will definitely come back!

You'll find this crepery inside New York New York and the prices are fairly standard as far as crepes are concerned and the portion size is generous, in my opinion.  I ordered the Steak and Mushroom crepe and the initial few bites were really good but then the creamy sauce became a tad overwhelming.  I should have stuck to a sweet crepe instead of a savory.  If you love crepes though, this place is a steal! Service was fine and fairly quick.

1) Speedy service and kind service
2) Great tasting flavor: hot, moist eggs, crispy bacon.
3) Reasonable prices for large portion sizes
4) great location in New York New York. Lots of seating and not too noisy for the morning

Great place to get a quick bite. You can also order dessert and savory crepes for lunch, dinner or dessert.

2 stars because the food was decent. Nothing special about it! And the lady that was making the crepes were so rude! She had the most sour look on her face. And when I had asked her if she could put the sauce on the side, she just gave me  an attitude about it.

Located in the very cool New York New York Hotel, which is worth a stop in just to see how cute is it in here, but also come for a crepe.

They have the huge crepe griddles and spread the batter on with little wooden squeegees. Which you get to watch through the glass.

A good option if you are looking for something casual and you have some time to wait but don't have the patience for a full sit down meal. I went on a saturday morning, and the pick up line was waaaay longer than the order line. I probably waited about 1-2 mins to place an order and then 15-20mins for my crepe. Not too bad, but could be frustrating if you were in a rush to get to a show.

What I tried:
Vegetarian crepe- lots of sauteed veggies and cheese in a pesto sauce. Could have used more sauce and got progressively less good as it cooled.

Steak with cheese and bechamel- like unto a philly cheese steak but in a crepe. It was delicious. Order this one and you will be very happy :)

I did not know what I wanted from this place. I watched the person before me get a Strawberry Chocolate Crepe. It looked good, so I ordered one myself. By the time I placed a sandwich order at Greenberg Deli, my crepe was ready.

Total with tax was $9.72. About right for a Custom Crepe at a tourist place, I guess.

Pros:
Service was good.

Cons:
Crepe was just alright. It was too sweet. (-1)

My best friend and I were looking for cheap but good crepes. These were phenomenal! She had the Nutella banana crepe with whipped cream. I had the vegetarian ($11) with egg added ($2). It has spinach, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes, and pesto sauce.

Good spot for crepes. Located in the restaurant, NYC downtown looking area next to the doors that lead out to the strip.

MyVegas slots brought me here. 2 for the price if 1, why not?

Surprised at the low ratings cause these crepes were actually very good. I ordered the Vegetarian. Bunch of veggies including MUSHROOMS all with some pesto sauce on top.

Crepe was delicious, very filling and definitely worth the price. Breakfast crepe I got too was pretty good and just as big.

2 for 1 I couldn't complain. MyVegas slots for the win.

I'll be back for sure.
Best food ever and it's quick you can even watch them make it i had the chocolate and strawberry one
Moderately priced, but the crepes are HUGE. Small menu and limited seating but worth it!!

This was our "go-to" breakfast place while we stayed at NYNY. I had the waffle and my bf had the ham and egg crepe. They were delicious. They cook everything that goes in the crepe when you order it, so non of that heat lamp food. For a quick breakfast it is a bit pricey.... $28 for a crepe, waffle and two coffees. 
For those who get an allergic reaction with "sugar-free" stuff, like me, make sure you ask an employee for a non sugar-free syrup if they don't have any in the front. 
So far we have yet to find a place that is just as good but we'll keep looking.

This is a solid 3-star crepe place. I've never tried anything else. We ordered the strawberry mascarpone crepe with a scope of ice cream. It was very good the first 4 bites and then it got too sweet especially the amount of mascarpone they added. I think as an already-created crepe, they should have added some type of pastry to add some tasty and flavors that could blend well. I would, however, come back once more and create my own. This would also be my recommendations.

Prologue:
My girlfriend and I were in the mood for something sweet right after seeing Zumanity at New York New York in Las Vegas.

The Plot:
We shared a Chocolate Banana Crepe, a Cappuccino, and an Espresso. 

The Scene:
The portion size was very good and plenty for the two of us.
The crepe itself was very yummy, filled with Nutella and sliced banana, and topped with more Nutella, chopped hazelnuts, powered sugar, and whipped cream.
The Cappuccino was also good and a nice accompaniment to the crepe.

The Rest of the Story:
This is not the place to order Espresso.

Epilogue:
We were both pleased as well as satisfied and this was the perfect way to conclude our night out together.

Photo design by Billie Z.

They have been open about 2 months in the New York New York Casino in Las Vegas.  MyVegas on Facebook just started offering a 2-for-1 deal, so I cashed in 5,000 Loyalty Points for a voucher good for $11 off.  They don't have a website or a menu on the casino website yet.  

There were about half a dozen sweet and half a dozen savory crepes offered.  We ordered at the cash register and picked up the food on the other end of the counter.  You can watch your crepe being made.

My friend chose the Breakfast Crepe and I had the Ham and Cheese Crepe.  The crepe was large and slightly doughy.  I'm used to a thinner, lighter, dryer crepe.

Next time we would order one savory and one sweet crepe and share the two.  We will be back.

Good size portion for the price you pay. I ordered the Bacon and Egg which was well cooked throughout. The bacon had a nice crunchy taste, but wasn't overcooked. A friend ordered the strawberry crepe which looked delicious, although she did mention it was very sweet by the end of it.

Just a side note, definitely bring your own drink because even bottled water was expensive. Seating was plenty around the food court area.

We stayed at the Luxor so this was an easy walk over.

Good crepes at a reasonable price.  The woman making the crepes was very funny and made the wait enjoyable.  They have all types of crepes from sweet to breakfast type.  The "Healthy Breakfast" one was my favorite.

I have a challenge to eat at 24 new places in 2017. This was #8. 

OVERALL RATING: 4.5 (SCORED  23.5 OUT OF 25)
STAFF: 5+ (All very friendly and enjoy working)
FOOD: 5
SERVICE: 3.5 (Multiple people working on your table, not just one waiter/waitress)
CLEANNESS: 5
PRICE: 5

STAFF: They only have two employees working, one at the cashier and one at the cooking station. Both are friendly and work their butts off! 

FOOD: The crepes are amazing! Lots of great flavors and lots of ingredients in the crepes. 

SERVICE: I went here twice. Once it took 45 minutes to get our crepes. Now, you can cook 4 crepes at a time and the cook was hustling to get things done. That is just how many people had gone by to get food! The other time we waited 10 minutes which was a good time. It didn't matter how long the wait, the quality was the same! 

CLEANNESS: Very clean! Items kept properly. 

PRICE: You get an amazing size crepe for a decent price.

My family and I stopped by this place about 30 mins before closing, and the staff just seemed so irritated that I even stopped by. I ordered a drawer every crepe, and it was a bit pricey. ($8?) The crepe itself was a bit chewy. But on the bright side, there was a ton of fresh fruit and the crepe was huge.

Amazing steak and mushroom crape! My husband really wanted the waffles but they didn't have any. This was a little upsetting as we went there just after they opened. The cashier was really nice and offered her suggestion. He ended up ordering the bacon and egg breakfast crape. It didn't take long at all and we went back to our room and ate. Both crapes were amazing. Highly recommend this place!
Crepes are HUGE, Vegas style price but we'll worth the money. Look this place up if your saying at New York New York.

This was a MUST STOP for my daughter on our trip to Vegas.  She had not stop talking about the Ham & Cheese crepe she had here last year!
Once again, she ordered the Ham & Cheese crepe.  She shared it with her friend, since they are pretty big.
They also shared a strawberry and marscapone  dessert crepe.  They both had happy tummies by the time we left!

Nice light food which is a good break from everything else Vegas has to offer. Buffalo chicken is really good, ham and cheese is decent, bacon and egg is good but too cheesy.

I stopped by a few times because its fast, not chain food and pretty tasty/cheap.

It was the second day in Vegas and we got up early.
Walking around waiting for stuff to open other than the money machines.
The place I wanted for alcohol was just setting up.
My daughter and I saw this place just off to the side in New York New York  already open and making crepes like a DJ dropping beats so we tried it .
They had a Lot of choses being on vaca I went with something and so did she. 
I got the blueberry crepe and my daughter got the chocolate with banana. 
She kept saying that she could not wait to eat while standing on line.
While eating my daughter claims that there was a little bit of banana but a bum load of chocolate.
Both crepes were really well made and tasty. 
Something to distract while waiting for openings.

I have no clue why the rating is so low.  This place was GREAT!!! The portions are large and you definitely get your moneys worth.  My sister and I split the lemon berry crepe and the buffalo chicken crepe.  All fresh ingredients and just very delicious. Plus the staff is very friendly.  I'd certainly go back next time I'm in Vegas.

This newly open creperie dishes out some yumm crepes.
They have a great mix of sweet and savory crepes.
I tried their banana with Nutella crepe and it was absolutely sinful.
Most of them are in the range of 8.50-9 and I think they are totally worth it
Give them a shot.You wont be disappointed.
My number one place for breakfast in all of Vegas! It's a little hidden gem in New York, New York. They have some of the best crepes ever. Staff is always very friendly and accommodating.

This newly opened crepe shop is tucked back into the adorable New York New York casino. We used 5,000 points from our MyVegas app (seriously, check out this app for awesome vegas freebies) to get the buy one get one deal on the crepes. 

There were about 6 sweet crepes to choose from, we tried the strawberry crepe filled with tons of fresh strawberries and Mascarpone  cheese. We also ordered the cannoli crepe. Sweet crepes run about $8.99 and savory crepes are about $9.99. Both crepes were great; huge and very decadent. If these puppies don't satisfy your sweet tooth, I don't know what will. 

Minus one star because I thought the batter was a little thick for my liking.

The crepe was not cooked through. The filling tomato basil caprese was still at  refrigerated temperature and the basil was inadequate for the amount of tomatoes.  If I could have returned it I would have.  Couldn't eat more than a quarter before giving up. Never again. Very disappointed!

Phenomenal! Second time in Vegas and I knew I absolutely needed to visit this place again! first time I fell in love with the food and now I will be making a point to come here every time! The crepes are made straight in front of you and are beautifully soft but crisp. They have a selection of both savory and sweet and they are so courteous!
The crepes were good and less expensive than the creperie at theMGM Grand where we were staying. We customized with strawberries, nutella & whip cream

OMG!  Diabetic nightmare but oh so good.  9:15 pm and just shared the S'more crepe for dessert with my wife.  Amazing! The crepes run from savory to sweet and breakfast to dinner.   Looking forward to tomorrow morning!

Their crepes are huge. I got the Chocolate Banana. It was stuffed with Nutella and bananas, with a dollop of whipped cream on the side, and drizzled chocolate. I only ate half of it and was stuffed. My hubby finished up the rest. This crepe was over the top sweet. Holy smokes, I could feel the diabetes coming on. A little less Nutella would have been fine. The crepe itself was thin and well made. Maybe I should have ordered it with other ingredients. 

My hubby's a simple person. He decided on the Crisp Malted Waffle. It was just a plain waffle that came with butter and maple syrup. The waffle was decent. It tasted like any other waffle. The syrup was in a container on the side. At least the waffle wasn't drenched in syrup.

Well would you look at that -- another time where Yelp underscores a place (although not by much, really).

I ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese crepe (maybe it was sausage, egg, and cheese, I don't remember, my girlfriend and I ordered both anyway), and was pleased with it. While I openly admit I'd rather have an omelette over a crepe, I was full after my breakfast here. We went here early enough in the morning to avoid any sort of line, so maybe that's why I don't at all hate this place. My crepe *was* lacking a little bit of salt or "oomph" because it *was* slightly bland, but they did have some Sriracha that I could have put on my crepe -- I just didn't for some dumb reason.

Of course, they also have breakfast/dessert crepes. My girlfriend's mom ordered a Nutella crepe and said it was way too sweet. I didn't try any, but that's because I much prefer savory over sweet for breakfast... or anytime, really.

48th and Crepe has a small but pretty good menu. I definitely didn't love the place (because like I said, I'm not big on crepes), but it was tasty and I was full afterwards. I think that warrants four stars.

This is a great little restaurant. It's almost like a food truck that's built into the wall. It's located inside the New York New York casino, near the Bar At Times Square. 

They offer savory and sweet crepes, as well as donuts and Starbucks mocha. I got the Healthy Breakfast which was pretty delicious (and vegetarian). My only complaint is the price and size -- about $10 per crepe and they are enormous. I couldn't finish mine. Other than that, pretty great.

This is a great spot to grab a bite while you are in Las Vegas. Whether you are looking for a place for breakfast or lunch, 48th and Crepe will not disappoint you. It is located in the New York New York Hotel and Casino. After reading all the reviews on Yelp, I had to stop by this place.

The menu is divided by 2 selections, the savory goodness which is basically a salty selection of crepes (ham and cheese, caprese, vegetarian) and the sweet side with chocolate and banana crepes, lemon twist, strawberry mascapone crepes to name a few.
I decided to try to the cannoli crepe and boy was it was delicious. The crepe was filled with orange flavored mascapone, ricotta cheese and all this yumminess was covered with a chocolate chip chocolate sauce.
The service was quick and friendly. The cashier was the one who suggested the cannoli crepe because it is her favorite and I am glad I listened to her. If crepes are not your thing, do not fret, they also have a breakfast selection menu where you can order bacon and eggs, waffles etc. 

In conclusion, 48th and Crepe may not be the biggest place but their menu is pretty good. You can have breakfast with the sweet side of the menu or the breakfast selection or lunch and dinner with the savory selection. I really enjoyed this place and would definitely encourage people who are either staying at the New York New York Hotel or in Las Vegas to check it out.

One star.  This place apparently shares a storefront with the hot dog joint, and for 3 days I went to their sister hot dog place and the lazy woman - even when I asked her to not put the mustard on top of the sauerkraut - put the mustard on top of the sauerkraut.  Out of sheer laziness.  The crepes are good.  The shared-door hot dog place is bad, and they staff it with this one enormously slow lady who ignores your requests so the sauerkraut falls off our dogs with the mustard on top when we ask her not to.  Really sad the managment wouldn't see people just leave the place when the line is too long to get a hot dog.

I would have to say this crepe place is just OK. Nothing special about it, they did have a ton of options but I found my crepe to be just mediocre. 

I ordered the healthy omelet with egg whites. I guess I should have gone with a more sweet option than savory. The line was pretty long, wasn't sure if the cashier was just taking a while to ring people up or the actual crepe making themselves were the hold up. 

The crepe chef was amazing and fun to watch while she spread the mix onto the hot plate. 

I would try it but, not my fav. The crepe place in Paris is by far the best.

This crepe is pretty good. I'm surprised because the food in the New York New York hotel looks more like a watered down theme park approximation of NYC food rather than anything close to the real thing. But this strawberry, cuz they were out of banana, Nutella crepe hit the important notes. Light, chewy, and delicious crepe filled to the brim with strawberries and Nutella. They are pricey but it's huge and easily feeds two. Don't think I'll get a chance to try the banana crepe which is a shame but I suspect, based on what I had, that would get them the 5th star.

Nutella and banana crepe was delicious! I went in the evening and there was no line. The next morning there was definitely a long line. The staff was nice... once I spoke to a staff member in Spanish he opened up way more. Another great eatery in nyny. Thank you staff!
Nasty nasty I had the ham and cheese crape the sauce and cheese tastes too artificial. A lot of crape places allow you to add fresh veggies too

I honestly can say this was the worst crepe I've ever had... ever.  And I've had lots of crepes, being that it is one of my favorite food.  Hubby and I wanted to get a snack before our flight.  So we decided to share a ham and cheese crepe.  First off, it was overpriced.  Which I understand.  It's inside a large casino.  So the one star is not because of the price.  The crepe was a good size crepe.  But it was undercooked and bland.  Very very very bland.  And I usually don't like too much salt in my food.  Add the not-so-friendly staff from the cashier to the person making the crepe and its price, make this a "Eek! Methinks not" joint for me.

Very average place! I ordered a vegetarian one which said pesto filling and there was no pesto on the base and was so dry! I have definitely had better! And also I got the chocolate banana one which had very little Nutella and was so dry again! Definitely do not recommend!
These are really good. We have had the healthy breakfast, ham and egg, bacon and egg, sausage and egg and the strawberry one. All were really good and left us all feeling full.

Holy S*** this was good! Got the steak and mushroom. Amazing flavor. We  are so happy we came here. I think I only want to eat here for the whole trip. The steak and mushroom had banana peppers and garlic sauce. Wow. Yum.
Hands down the best crepe I've ever had! I went with something sweet and got the strawberry crepe and added Nutella! It was amazing! I went back the day after for round 2!

After reading all the great reviews of this place, me and my guest opted to have our first breakfast during our vacay here at NYNY.  We split a nutella/banana crepe (they are fairly large and are shareable).   I had hyped this place up to my guest, telling them they were going to have amazing crepes, etc. etc.  Totally a letdown.  The crepe itself was nothing special, didn't seem particularly great texture or soft,  - just boring.   The nutella filling basically tasted like overly sweet chocolate.  I felt it had way too much chocolate filling, so it seemed like every bite was a mouthful of gloppy chocolate and not enough crepe. (and the nutella flavor was very lacking, if you are nutella fan).  We were both somewhat overloaded with chocolate to the point that we felt like we needed something else to cope with all  the sweet.  yuck.   If people think that's what  a crepe is supposed to be , then I guess they haven't had very many crepes in their life. A tender fluffy crepe,  balanced with  delicacy, subtle flavors - that's what makes a  great crepe (and crepe filling.) 

Maybe they have other crepes here that are better, but we were totally unimpressed and won't be back. ( we would have been very unhappy if we'd each had our own, at $10 each.  At least we split it and saved our wallets a little).
The personal there is slow as no rude.  Probably, I shouldn't expect more than such as place...

I ordered the chocolate banana and it was delicious! Love the options for breakfast lunch or dessert! Depending on the time you get there you may have a wait. Over all I would recommend and I plan to come back again!

Chocolate banana crepe: $8.99 (top)
Peach cobbler crepe: $8.99 (bottom)

One crepe is definitely enough to feed two to three people. The crepes are pretty big in size, rich in taste, and sweet. There is homemade whipped cream added on top and lots of filling. 

If you haven't had a crepe before, I recommend the chocolate banana crepe. The peach cobbler crepe might be seasonal. The peaches used taste like canned peaches, so they aren't as "fresh" as some of the other crepes available. 

This place is located inside New York New York hotel where all of the other little restaurants are located. Perfect place if you have a sweet tooth, but there are also savory crepes available.

This is a no-frills restaurant that serves a variety of crepes (sweet and savory), one type of waffle, Krispy Kreme donuts, and some drinks. I opted for the waffle because it was $6.99. Their sweet crepes were $8.99, and their savory crepes were $9.99. The crepes were a bit too pricey for me, as well as their Krispy Kreme Donuts ($1.75 per donut). 

The waffle was very plain. I asked for my whipped cream on the side and got a small ice cream scoop of it. She sprinkled some powdered sugar on top. Butter, sugar-free syrup, and utensils were self-serve.

The waffle was decent, but it didn't taste spectacular. If I come back here again, I'll try their crepes.
Ordinary breakfast. Didn't find it very interesting. I wish I had read the reviews before deciding to go here
Worth the wait. I must give the whole credit to the lady that are doing them. She is amazing and great service. Even gave me a free coffee for the wait.
It was good, price is reasonable for Vegas. I thought they were pretty fast! My family loved it!
Used myVegas comp and got the steak and mushroom crepe AND the chocolate banana crepe with strawberries on the side. Total for everything $8.98. Delicious! I'm stuffed. Burp.
Couldn't find it! Literally walked around for twenty minutes and couldn't find it! No signs, no maps, no google!

Mom and I each had the "Healthy Breakfast" crepe and with coffee, I thought $23 was perhaps too much even if it turned out to be one of our least expensive meals in LV. But when our number was called, I was pleased to see that we each had a very well stuffed crepe.

I don't know if it was the egg whites, but even with grilled veggies it needed salt and pepper to give it some real flavor. And ketchup. No salt or pepper nearby though - we had to hunt for it.

Seating is nearby and good luck as it is shared with the deli and the hot dog places. As well, the occasional smoker walks past since this is inside the casino.

Came here for breakfast twice.  It's located in the New York New York, and they have a wonderful mix of sweet and savory crepes.  My favorite was the vegetarian and my girl went with the breakfast crepe for both visits.  The crepes were tasty and very filling, good for a meal or snack.  Now, they weren't the best crepes I've ever had, but they were enjoyable.  I'd come back.
Uff-da! Huge and not that spendy! Mom had lemon curd and I had sausage and?? with bechamel. Yummy, Pick one and split. I gave my leftover half to a homeless guy sleeping on a walkway.

Had a dessert crepe (banana and nutella) after we watched "Zumanity." The crepe itself was yummy, but the ladies there looked absolutely miserable. There was no "love" being put in to cooking...and they didn't have gelato or ice cream to put in our crepe. Boo.
I still stand by that these crepes are so good! Especially, Buy 1, get 1 free!  Worth getting on myVegas.
The crepes here were delicious; I can't wait to come back to Las Vegas and visit 48th and Crepe!

Went there with no expectations and came out with a VERY SATISFYING EXPERIENCE!! Located at the NY NY hotel the crepes are made fresh and there are a good number of savory and sweet options! I love that the portions are very generous with a fantastic deal (~$9-$10 each). I ordered the healthy breakfast and chocolate banana crepes and was so happy that the healthy crepe didn't taste bland at all! The chocolate banana one was a wonderful dessert! Loved my crepes and will definitely make another visit there

Great little spot!!
I highly recommend this place if staying at or near the New York New York . I got the ham and egg and my girl got the blueberry. Very generous portion and worth the 8-9 dollar plate you get . The breakfast ones are better in my opinion than the sweet ones but both are amazing

The smores crepe is like something straight out of my dreams! I'm so glad we stumbled upon this place for breakfast at NY NY as we were staying at MGM Grand. Just a short walk and no regrets! Still craving it weeks after being there. Will absolutely go back next trip to Vegas! It was also very neat watching them make the crepes.
